intro: Rhamnus infectoria f. linearifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved buckthorn, is a variant of the buckthorn plant characterized by its elongated, linear leaves. It is a deciduous shrub native to parts of Europe and Asia, typically found in woodland edges and rocky soils. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers in early spring, followed by dark blue berries that are an important food source for birds. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their astringent properties. The species is notable for its adaptability to various environmental conditions.
